summary: Add documentation and validation to disallow keyword arguments in activities, workflows, signals, queries, and updates, ensuring consistency with Temporal's positional-only parameter model across all SDKs.
userImpact: Users may attempt to use keyword arguments in workflows/activities not realizing they are unsupported, leading to runtime failures or confusion.
rootCause: Temporal only supports positional parameters in its serialized form, and keyword arguments create ambiguity in parameter arity across different SDKs.
proposedFix: Add validation at workflow/activity/signal/query/update definition time with clear error messages, and document this restriction prominently in README.
resolutionDetails: Issue was closed indicating the feature request was addressed with documentation and validation rules implemented.
keyQuote: All Temporal SDKs only support positional parameters, and all Temporal SDKs strongly encourage a single parameter that is an object/dict that can have fields added.
